alert.note: Alert for John Day Basin; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 8:17PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Grant County through 845 PM PDT... At 816 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hamilton, or 32 miles northwest of John Day, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monument, Ritter and Hamilton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: John Day Basin; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon
